zc.thread
Class Future

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--zc.thread.Future
public class Future
extends java.lang.Object

A Future represents the results of an asynchronous computation. Futures maintain a single value serving as the result of an operation. The result cannot be accessed until the computation has completed.

get

public java.lang.Object get()
                     throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Obtains the value of the Future.
block (possibly forever) until the value is made available.
Returns:
an Object the value of the Future.
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - if the calling thread is interrupted while waiting.

get

public java.lang.Object get(long msecs)
                     throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                            TimeoutException
Obtains the value of the Future.
block for at most msecs milliseconds waiting for the value to be made available. If the value is not available after msec milliseconds a TimeoutException is thrown.
Parameters:
msecs - the number of milliseconds to wait before giving up.
Returns:
an Object the value of the Future.
Throws:
TimeoutException - if not ready after msecs

set

public void set(java.lang.Object inObject)
Set the value of the Future and make it available to waiting Threads.

isSet

public boolean isSet()
Returns true if and only if the future value is ready.
Returns:
a boolean
